New Records: Freddie Freeman tied the Yankees' Bobby Richardson in 1960 for the World Series record with 12 RBIs in the series.
Freddie Freeman set a record by homering in six consecutive World Series games dating to 2021.
Giancarlo Stanton homered for the seventh time this postseason, setting a Yankees record.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers overcame a five-run deficit to win Game 5, 7-6.
Mookie Betts hit a sacrifice fly in the eighth inning to secure the Dodgers' victory.
Freddie Freeman's two-run single in the fifth inning tied the game.
Teoscar Hernández's double in the fifth inning brought home two runs to tie the game.
Walker Buehler struck out Alex Verdugo for the final out to clinch the World Series for the Dodgers.
Pre-Game Insights: The showdown between Shohei Ohtani and Aaron Judge was highly anticipated.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed heartbreak over the Yankees' loss, stating, 'I'm heartbroken. It doesn't take away my pride of what that means to me and what that group forged this year.'
Dave Roberts praised Blake Treinen's performance, saying, 'Blake's our guy. Blake's been our guy.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani played despite a shoulder injury sustained in Game 2.
The Dodgers won their eighth World Series championship, their first since 2020 and their first following a 162-game season since 1988.
Freddie Freeman was named World Series MVP.
